dataset.title: CAN-SAR: A database for Canadian species at risk information

abstract.markdown: CAN-SAR: A database of Canadian Species at Risk information is an initiative led by Dr. Ilona Naujokaitis-Lewis from Environment Climate Change Canada. The aim of this database is to provide open and accessible data reflecting information obtained from Canadian species at risk listing and recovery planning documents. Ongoing efforts include development of a living database that will facilitate contributions from other parties in an effort to increase efficiencies and decrease multiple (redundant) efforts with the broad over-arching goal of improving the conservation of species at risk. **NOTE:** The current version of CAN-SAR includes documents available as of **March 23, 2021** for species with SARA statuses Special Concern, Threatened, or Endangered. For the authoritative source of current species at risk information please consult the SARA Public Registry (https://www.canada.ca/en/environment-climate-change/services/species-risk-public-registry.html).

licensed.licenseName: Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International Public License

contact.organizationName: National Wildlife Research Centre, Environment and Climate Change Canada

dataTable.entityDescription: CAN-SAR: A database of Canadian species at risk information

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier for each document. Extraction details: There is one row per document.
Unique identifier for each species or designatable unit. Extraction details: There will be multiple entries for each species if there is more than one document published.
Common name of species and population. Extraction details: Common name and population directly transcribed from the title page.

textDomain.definition: Common name of species and population.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Binomial name of species. Extraction details: Scientific name directly transcribed from the document title.
The type of document. Extraction details: COSEWIC Status Reports includes Status Appraisal Summaries.

The status of the species listed under SARA Schedule 1. Extraction details: The Schedule 1 status under SARA. It can be different from the status assessed by COSEWIC. It should be apparent from the 'Protection, status and rank section' of the executive summary in a Status Report, or the preface or executive summary of a Recovery Strategy or Management Plan. The species profile on the SAR Public Registry site also gives the status.
The citation for the document. Extraction details: Directly transcribed from the 2nd page of the document.

URL for the SAR Public Registry website search page filtered to the species common name. Extraction details: Constructed from the url for the SAR Public Registry species search page using the common name as a keyword.

textDomain.definition: URL for the SAR Public Registry website search page filtered to the species common name.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Date the document was made available on the SAR Public Registry website. Extraction details: Directly transcribed from the document entry on the SAR Public Registry website. Found in the square brackets beside the title.
The publication year of the document. Extraction details: From the title page.
The date when the document was last accessed. Extraction details: Recorded when the document was downloaded.
Is the document a status appraisal summary or rapid review? Extraction details: 0' unless the title includes 'Status Appraisal Summary' or 'Rapid Review.'
Is the document a final version? Extraction details: 1' unless the document is a Recovery Strategy or Management Plan and says 'proposed' in the title
Is the document an amendment to an earlier version? Extraction details: 0' unless the document has 'amended' or 'amendment' in the title.
Taxonomic group. Extraction details: The taxonomic group used in the document to describe the species.
Last names and first initials of all Status Report writers. Extraction details: From the 'Production note' in the Status Report. Author last name, Initial of first name, e.g. Smith J, Stewart R

textDomain.definition: Last names and first initials of all Status Report writers.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Estimated Extent of Occurrence: 'The area included in a polygon without concave angles that encompasses the geographic distribution of all known populations of a wildlife species” https://www.cosewic.ca/index.php/en-ca/about-us/definitions-abbreviations.html. Extraction details: From the 'Technical summary' in the Status Report. When multiple numbers were given the larger was used, if a range was given the mean was used.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: not recorded or specified as unknown in the report

attribute.attributeDefinition: Index of area of occupancy: “The area within the 'extent of occurrence' that is occupied by a taxon, excluding cases of vagrancy” https://www.cosewic.ca/index.php/en-ca/about-us/definitions-abbreviations.html. Extraction details: From the 'Technical summary' in the Status Report. When multiple numbers were specified the larger was used, if a range was specified the mean was used.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: not recorded or specified as unknown in the report

attribute.attributeDefinition: The number of locations that the species occupies. A location is defined as: “a geographically or ecologically distinct area in which a single threatening event can rapidly affect all individuals of the taxon present” https://www.cosewic.ca/index.php/en-ca/about-us/definitions-abbreviations.html. Extraction details: From the 'Technical summary' in the Status Report. When multiple numbers were specified the larger was used, if a range was specified the mean was used.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: not recorded or specified as unknown in the report

attribute.attributeDefinition: Whether the species only occurs in North America. Extraction details: From the 'Distribution' section of the Status Report.
Whether the species only occurs in Canada. Extraction details: From the 'Distribution' section of the Status Report.

Whether the species range is continuous with at least one population in the USA. Extraction details: The range is continuous if not all Canadian populations are geographically isolated from American populations. Determined from the 'Distribution' and 'Rescue effect' sections of the Status Report.
Status assessed by COSEWIC. Extraction details: The COSEWIC status from the Status Report title page.
Provinces, territories, or oceans where the species is present. Extraction details: Extracted from the Status Report.
Date that the COSEWIC assessment was completed. Extraction details: Extracted from the SAR Public Registry Species Profile under Last assessment date.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: event has not occurred, data is not available, or not a Status Report

attribute.attributeDefinition: Date that the species was added to SARA Schedule 1. Extraction details: Extracted from the SAR Public Registry Species Profile under Date added.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: event has not occurred, data is not available, or not a Status Report

attribute.attributeDefinition: The decision made by the Governor in Council (GIC). Extraction details: Extracted from the SAR Public Registry Species Profile under GIC Decision.

codeDefinition.definition: event has not occurred, data is not available, or not a Status Report

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: event has not occurred, data is not available, or not a Status Report

attribute.attributeDefinition: Whether critical habitat is identified in the Recovery Strategy. Extraction details: Based on the critical habitat section of the Recovery Strategy. If critical habitat is described as fully identified or identified to the extent possible then a 'Y' was recorded. If critical habitat was described as partially identified then a 'P' was recorded. If critical habitat was not identified then an 'N' was recorded and if the document is not a Recovery Strategy then NA was recorded.

Sub-types of actions described in the Recovery Strategy or Management Plan. Extraction details: The actions described in the Recovery Strategy or Management Plan that are completed, underway or recommended for recovery. The actions were categorized into 16 types of actions which are described in the Action Types sheet.

codeDefinition.definition: Community outreach, stewardship or education activities including providing information, hosting meetings, and coordinating with stakeholders.
Actions aimed at reducing or preventing greenhouse gas emission.

Gathering data to document trends over space and time, including population, harvesting, or habitat trends, and to assess effectiveness and track progress towards conservation and population objectives.

Producing new knowledge that contributes to improved understanding of a species, including but not limited to life history, population size and distribution, response to threats and response to actions.
Imposing restrictions on direct human threats such as changing logging, fishing or hunting rules, or legislation to manage other threats like pollution.
Modifying habitat to improve suitability for species, including connectivity features like fish ladders, and culverts.
Removing invasive species that have negative impacts on species or habitats.
Protecting habitat in any way including by zoning or creating protected areas. Including when a large portion of the population exists inside a protected area.
Treating individuals or populations to prevent disease.

codeDefinition.code: Manage native species negatively impacting species at risk
codeDefinition.definition: Relocating, culling, or excluding native predators including herbivores and cormorants.
Storing plant seeds in case of a need for reintroduction.
Artificially increasing the amount of prey or food available.
Emergency measures to prevent extinction or extirpation, or prevent mortality by taking direct action.
Ex situ breeding to recover or maintain the population.
Artificially reintroducing or augmenting populations at inhabited or previously inhabited sites.
Moving species to previously unoccupied sites.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Note by the data extractor explaining the reason for the action classification or a quote from the document that demonstrates it. Extraction details: Optional field included if some clarification was needed.

textDomain.definition: Note by the data extractor explaining the reason for the action classification or a quote from the document that demonstrates it.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Whether any actions are described in the Management Plan or Recovery Strategy that address climate change. Extraction details: An action was considered to address climate change if climate change was listed as the threat addressed or the reason the action was necessary.
The sub-type of action that addresses climate change. Extraction details: The action sub-type for the action(s) that address climate change.

codeDefinition.definition: Community outreach, stewardship or education activities including providing information, hosting meetings, and coordinating with stakeholders.
Actions aimed at reducing or preventing greenhouse gas emission.

Gathering data to document trends over space and time, including population, harvesting, or habitat trends, and to assess effectiveness and track progress towards conservation and population objectives.

Producing new knowledge that contributes to improved understanding of a species, including but not limited to life history, population size and distribution, response to threats and response to actions.
Imposing restrictions on direct human threats such as changing logging, fishing or hunting rules, or legislation to manage other threats like pollution.
Modifying habitat to improve suitability for species, including connectivity features like fish ladders, and culverts.
Removing invasive species that have negative impacts on species or habitats.
Protecting habitat in any way including by zoning or creating protected areas. Including when a large portion of the population exists inside a protected area.
Treating individuals or populations to prevent disease.

codeDefinition.code: Manage native species negatively impacting species at risk
codeDefinition.definition: Relocating, culling, or excluding native predators including herbivores and cormorants.
Storing plant seeds in case of a need for reintroduction.
Artificially increasing the amount of prey or food available.
Emergency measures to prevent extinction or extirpation, or prevent mortality by taking direct action.
Ex situ breeding to recover or maintain the population.
Artificially reintroducing or augmenting populations at inhabited or previously inhabited sites.
Moving species to previously unoccupied sites.

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: CC_action is not '1' or not a recovery document

attribute.attributeDefinition: Note by the data extractor explaining the reason for the action classification or a quote from the document that demonstrates it. Extraction details: Optional field included if some clarification was needed.

textDomain.definition: Note by the data extractor explaining the reason for the action classification or a quote from the document that demonstrates it.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Types of actions described in the Recovery Strategy or Management Plan. Extraction details: Action sub-types were grouped in to 4 action types based on the table in the Action Types sheet.

codeDefinition.definition: See action sub-types: Regulate human activities, Habitat restoration, Invasive species removal, Protection, Treat disease, Manage native species negatively impacting species at risk
See action sub-types: Education, Mitigate climate change
See action sub-types: Seed storage, Feeding, Emergency response, Captive breeding, Re-establishing populations, Translocation

attribute.attributeDefinition: The type of action that addresses climate change. Extraction details: The action type for the action(s) that address climate change. An action was considered to address climate change if climate change was listed as the threat addressed or the reason the action was necessary.

codeDefinition.definition: See action sub-types: Regulate human activities, Habitat restoration, Invasive species removal, Protection, Treat disease, Manage native species negatively impacting species at risk
See action sub-types: Education, Mitigate climate change
See action sub-types: Seed storage, Feeding, Emergency response, Captive breeding, Re-establishing populations, Translocation

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: CC_action is not '1' or not a recovery document

attribute.attributeDefinition: Whether climate change was not mentioned any where in the document. Extraction details: Documents were searched for the word climat* and related words warm*, temperature and drought to determine if anthropogenic climate change was mentioned.

Whether the threat of climate change was described as unknown. Extraction details: For documents without a threats calculator, when the threat of climate change is described as unknown, or as having unknown effects on the species. Where a document uses a threats calculator, if 'unknown' is assigned to impact, scope, severity, or timing. Or, for all documents, if further studies on the effects of climate change are described as needed.

Whether the threat of climate change was in the knowledge gap section. Extraction details: '0' if climate change was not in the 'Knowledge gaps' section, '1' if it was identified in the 'Knowledge gaps' section, 'NR' if no knowledge gaps section is present in the document, 'NA' if climate change is not identified as a threat.

Whether the impact of climate change was described as unknown. See X#_iucn_impact below for definition of impact. Extraction details: Identified based on the threats calculator or the text explaining the threat. '1' if it is identified as unknown (uncertain, incomplete data, lack of studies), '0' if it is known, 'NR' if it is not mentioned or not discussed. Prioritized the threats calculator for this information and if a level 2 threat was identified as unknown, enter the data as unknown. 'NA' if climate change is not identified as a threat.

Whether the scope of climate change was described as unknown. See X#_iucn_scope below for definition of scope. Extraction details: Identified based on the threats calculator or the text explaining the threat. '1' if it is identified as unknown (uncertain, incomplete data, lack of studies), '0' if it is known, 'NR' if it is not mentioned or not discussed. Prioritized the threats calculator for this information and if a level 2 threat was identified as unknown, enter the data as unknown. 'NA' if climate change is not identified as a threat.

Whether the severity of climate change was described as unknown. See X#_iucn_severity below for definition of severity. Extraction details: Identified based on the threats calculator or the text explaining the threat. '1' if it is identified as unknown (uncertain, incomplete data, lack of studies), '0' if it is known, 'NR' if it is not mentioned or not discussed. Prioritized the threats calculator for this information and if a level 2 threat was identified as unknown, enter the data as unknown. 'NA' if climate change is not identified as a threat.

Whether the timing of climate change was described as unknown. See X#_iucn_timing below for definition of timing. Extraction details: Identified based on the threats calculator or the text explaining the threat. '1' if it is identified as unknown (uncertain, incomplete data, lack of studies), '0' if it is known, 'NR' if it is not mentioned or not discussed. Prioritized the threats calculator for this information and if a level 2 threat was identified as unknown, enter the data as unknown. 'NA' if climate change is not identified as a threat.

Whether climate change is identified as a threat. Extraction details: If the threats calculator was included in the document, climate change was considered a threat if the 'Climate change and severe weather' threat class had an impact that was more than negligible or if climate change was described outside the threats calculator as a threat or potential threat.
If a threats calculator is not completed it is considered identified as a threat if it is described in the threats and limiting factors section as having a negative or potentially negative impact on the species.
Note it is possible for the 'Climate change and severe weather' threat category to be identified as having an impact without climate change being identified, such as cases where natural storms, flooding or drought that are not related to climate change are a threat.

The impact of climate change relative to other threats. Extraction details: Based on descriptions of threats in the document, the relative impact of climate change was scored as '0' if it was not a threat, '1' if it was described as a minor, potential, possible, or other threat, '2' if it was a significant threat but not the most important or if it was among the list of threats with no indication of relative importance or '3' if it was among the most important threats described.
Whether an 'IUCN Threats Assessment' was included in the document. Extraction details: The threats calculator is either included in the 'Threats' section of the document or as an appendix.

The version of the threats classification scheme that was used. Extraction details: There are 2 possible versions, v1.1 where threat 8 has 3 level 2 categories and there is no 11.5, and v2.3 where threat 8 has 6 level 2 categories and 11.5 is other impacts. If categories 8 and 11 are not included in the threats calculator assumed version 1.1.
Date given on threats calculator. Extraction details: Directly transcribed from the threats calculator table.
Names of assessors listed on threats calculator. Extraction details: Directly transcribed from the threats calculator table.

textDomain.definition: Names of assessors listed on threats calculator.

attribute.attributeDefinition: References listed on threats calculator. Extraction details: Directly transcribed from the threats calculator table.
Calculated overall threat impact. Extraction details: Directly transcribed from the threats calculator table. Can be a range i.e. High - Low.
Assigned overall threat impact. Extraction details: Directly transcribed from the threats calculator table. Can be a range i.e. High - Low.
Impact adjustment reasons. Extraction details: Directly transcribed from the threats calculator table.
Overall threat comments. Extraction details: Directly transcribed from the threats calculator table.

Whether the level 1 threat class was identified. The # indicates which threat class of the 11 level 1 classes was identified. Extraction details: If a threats calculator was used the threat is considered identified if the impact is anything other than blank or 'Not a Threat'. If a threats calculator was not used threats described in the document were classified into the appropriate category based on version 1.1 of the IUCN-CMP Direct Threats Classification (Salafsky et al, 2008). See Threat Classes sheet for class definitions. When a threats calculator was used but only level 2 threats were filled in, the level 1 threat was considered identified if any level 2 threats were identified. Impact, scope, severity and timing were left as 'NA' if level 2 threats were filled in but not level 1.

Whether the level 2 threat class was identified. The # indicates which of the level 2 threat classes was identified e.g.: 2.2. Extraction details: If a threats calculator was used the threat is considered identified if the impact is anything other than blank or 'Not a Threat'. If a threats calculator was not used threats described in the document were classified into the appropriate category based on version 1.1 of the IUCN-CMP Direct Threats Classification (Salafsky et al, 2008). See Threat Classes sheet for class definitions. When there was inadequate or incomplete information about a level 2 threat (e.g.: do not specify what kind of agriculture (farm, crop, etc.) a '2' is recorded for all level 2 threats that could be the one described.

The degree to which a species or ecosystem is observed, inferred, or suspected to be directly or indirectly threatened by the above threat (COSEWIC, 2012). Extraction details: The impact value from the 'IUCN Threats Assessment Worksheet' for the level 1 or 2 threat. When the value is a range the mean was recorded.

The proportion of the species or ecosystem that can reasonably be expected to be affected by the threat within 10 years with continuation of current circumstances and trends (COSEWIC, 2012). Extraction details: The scope value from the 'IUCN Threats Assessment Worksheet' for the level 1 or 2 threat. When there was a range of values specified, the mean was recorded.

The level of damage to the species or ecosystem from the above threat that can reasonably be expected with continuation of current circumstances and trends (including potential new threats), assessed within a 10-year or three-generation timeframe, whichever is longer (up to 100 years) (COSEWIC, 2012). Extraction details: The severity value from the 'IUCN Threats Assessment Worksheet' for the level 1 or 2 threat. When there was a range of values specified, the mean was recorded.

codeDefinition.definition: > 0% reduction of the species’ population within next 10 years or 3 generations (Neutral or Potential Benefit)
< 1% reduction of the species’ population within next 10 years or 3 generations (Negligible)
1–10% reduction of the species’ population within next 10 years or 3 generations (Slight)
11–30% reduction of the species’ population within next 10 years or 3 generations (Moderate)
31–70% reduction of the species’ population within next 10 years or 3 generations (Serious)
71–100% reduction of the species’ population within next 10 years or 3 generations (Extreme)

attribute.attributeDefinition: The immediacy of the above threat to the species (COSEWIC, 2012). Extraction details: The timing value from the 'IUCN Threats Assessment Worksheet' for the level 1 or 2 threat. When there was a range of values specified, the mean was recorded.

codeDefinition.definition: Only in the past and unlikely to return, or no direct effect but limiting (Insignificant/Negligible)
Only in the long term future or now suspended (Low)
Only in the short-term future or now suspended (Moderate)

attribute.attributeDefinition: Comments about the level 1 or 2 threat included in the threats calculator table. Extraction details: Directly transcribed from the threats calculator table.

textDomain.definition: Comments about the level 1 or 2 threat included in the threats calculator table.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Note by the data extractor explaining the reason for the threat classification or a quote from the document that demonstrates it. Extraction details: Where the threat descriptions were not clear, and thus classification of threats could be affected, the data extractor may include notes to explain the selection.

textDomain.definition: Note by the data extractor explaining the reason for the threat classification or a quote from the document that demonstrates it.
